topic.title: ZeroNet, browser bundle?
topic.body:
We need to get rid of this: "http://127.0.0.1:43110/", and it should be out of the box feature.

How about making ZeroNet a browser bundle like Tor is?

1528080237_1PMuHrGm4GFBBNbvRgr8zvyyRTc3r.body: I think some incentive to share would be great, but I would stay away from greedy ICO scams like IPFS' filecoin. Some sort of automatic bitcoin payments for sharing certain files could work.

I think the existing donation addresses could be used to incentivise sharing files which have no peers. There could be option to share file for a fee, but ZeroNet browser would only use these peers if no free peers would be available. In this case a popup would appear asking whether to pay the requested amount to peer.
